S.FORM: pitu tmucing saniq tehoq cu pqwasan biru.
S.TRANSL: 我今天七點到學校。
I arrived at school at seven today.

S.FORM: tgaring ta tqbaq biru la, miyuk cka sesiy, kmayan hancyo, “tuliq! tmatuk tunux!”
S.TRANSL: 上課了，老師走進教室，班長說:「起立!敬禮!」
It’s time for class , the teacher walked into the classroom, and the monitor said: “Stand up! Salute!”

S.FORM: mlawa cami maha: “sesiy lokah.”
S.TRANSL: 我們大聲的說:「老師好。」
We said loudly, “Hi, teacher.”

S.FORM: tqbaq cami mqwas biru ga, sbaqan cami nya ke lmpux na Tayal.
S.TRANSL: 上課的時候，老師教我們數字的族語。
In class, the teacher taught us the Tayal language of numbers.

S.FORM: glux cami sesiy lmpux ru, mqwas cami qwas na lmpux.
S.TRANSL: 我們跟著老師唸，我們唱了數字歌。
We followed the teacher to read, we sang the number song.

S.FORM: piyux wayal mu tbaqan ke na tayal la.
S.TRANSL: 我學會好多族語。
I have learned many Tayal languages.

S.FORM: musa cu pqwasan biru krryax, tqbaq cu ke tayal krryax, skayan ru ppunung ni yaya mu.
S.TRANSL: 我天天上學，我天天學族語，我要講給媽媽聽。
I go to school every day, I learn the Tayal language every day, and I want to tell my mother.

S.FORM: lalu mu ga Maray.
S.TRANSL: 我的名字是Maray。
My name is Maray.

S.FORM: lalu yaba mu ga Yosi.
S.TRANSL: 我爸爸的名字是Yosi。
My dad’s name is Yosi.

S.FORM: lalu yaya mu ga Miyo.
S.TRANSL: 我媽媽的名字是Miyo。
My mother’s name is Miyo.

S.FORM: mpux kawas mu la.
S.TRANSL: 我今年10歲。
I am 10 years old.

S.FORM: maki qutux qbsuyal mu mlikuy, Hayun lalu nya, mpux qutux kawas nya la.
S.TRANSL: 我有一個哥哥，他叫Hayun，他今年11歲。
I have a brother, his name is Hayun, he is 11 years old.

S.FORM: msqun cami mqwas qutux pqwasan biru.
S.TRANSL: 我們在同一間學校讀書。
We study in the same school.

S.FORM: smoya cami calay mqwas qwas.
S.TRANSL: 我和哥哥都喜歡唱歌。
Both my brother and I like to sing.

S.FORM: smoya cu lmngyaq, ryax hngawan lga, msqun cami musa lmngyaq qabax muyax myan.
S.TRANSL: 我喜歡游泳，放假的時候，我們全家會一起去游泳。
I like swimming. During the holidays, our whole family go swimming together.

S.FORM: piyux qnbaq mu qayus na rangi, msqun cami mqwas qwas ru lmngyaq.
S.TRANSL: 我喜歡認識新朋友，我們可以一起唱歌和游泳。
I love meeting new people, we can sing and swim together.

S.FORM: kingan ga laqi na Tayal.
S.TRANSL: 我是泰雅族的小孩。
I am an Tayal child.

S.FORM: cyan maki Skikun muyax myan.
S.TRANSL: 我們家住在四季。
Our family lives in Skikun.

S.FORM: magan qabax he muyax myan.
S.TRANSL: 我們家共有五個人。
There are five people in our family.

S.FORM: tyugan mcwhi qabax muyax myan.
S.TRANSL: 我們家有三個兄弟姊妹。
There are three brothers and sisters in our family.

S.FORM: msqun cu yaba yaya qbsuyal mlikuy ru qbsuyal kneril maki muyax.
S.TRANSL: 我跟爸爸、媽媽、哥哥和姊姊住在一起。
I live with my father, mother, brother and sister.

S.FORM: hlawax calay yaba mu, cyan alan knsat hiya.
S.TRANSL: 我的爸爸很高，我的爸爸是警察。
My father is tall and he is a policeman.

S.FORM: hekang calay yaya mu, cyan alan ising hiya.
S.TRANSL: 我的媽媽很瘦，我的媽媽是醫生。
My mother is thin and my mom is a doctor.

S.FORM: baq cami kmayan ke Tayal ki yaba mu maki cqa muyax.
S.TRANSL: 爸爸在家會和我們說族語。
My father speaks the ethnic language with us at home.

S.FORM: hngawan cqa ryax ’bagan ga musa cami qalang.
S.TRANSL: 我們暑假都會回部落。
We will all go back to the tribe during the summer vacation.

S.FORM: msqun cami kimyap qtangu ki qbsuyal mlikuy ru kneril.
S.TRANSL: 我和兄姊會一起抓青蛙。
My brothers and sisters and I will catch frogs together.

S.FORM: siyan mu calay he muyax myan qani.
S.TRANSL: 我很喜歡我們家的人。
I like our family very much.

S.FORM: msqun cu musa mcisan tanux ki yaya mu.
S.TRANSL: 今天我和媽媽出去玩。
I went out with my mother today.

S.FORM: mtasiq ru blaq kayal nya saniq coni, ini kltu ini kilux kayal nya, sqblaq calay qsliq behuy qani.
S.TRANSL: 白天的天空很藍，天氣不冷也不熱，風很涼爽。
The sky is blue during the day, the weather is neither cold nor hot, and the wind is cool.

S.FORM: mtama cami roq ru maniq cami menpaw, lhol calay he sbu’ cami nya wagi qani.
S.TRANSL: 我們在草地上吃著麵包，陽光灑在身上，非常溫暖。
We ate bread on the grass, the sun was shining on us, and it was very warm.

S.FORM: babaw knryax lga, mtalah qa kayal la.
S.TRANSL: 下午，天空變紅了。
In the afternoon, the sky turned red.

S.FORM: tbaqan mu yaya mu, cwa baq mtalah qa kayal qani.
S.TRANSL: 我問媽媽，為甚麼天空是紅色的。
I asked my mother why the sky is red.

S.FORM: kmayan yaya maha, pbehuy hayi lay.
S.TRANSL: 媽媽說，可能是颱風要來了。
Mom said, maybe the typhoon is coming.

S.FORM: uka yulung nya gbiyan qani ru, mhtux qa knituh nya la.
S.TRANSL: 晚上天上沒有雲，星星出來了。
There were no clouds in the sky at night, and the stars came out.

S.FORM: musa cami muyax uyi la.
S.TRANSL: 我們也要回家了。
We were going home too.

S.FORM: maki cami cka ryaniq ga, psina cu knalu ru pzimu cu knituh qani.
S.TRANSL: 在回家的路上，我跟星星許願。
On the way home, I made a wish with the stars,

S.FORM: akya ini uwah qa behuy qani, smoya cu calay musa mcisan tanux loyi.
S.TRANSL: 希望颱風不要來，我還想再出去玩。
I hope the typhoon doesn't come, I still want to go out to play again.

S.FORM: cyan maki biyh muyax myan qa pqawasn biru, khangi cu musa pqawasn biru ru, khangi cu mwah muyax uyi.
S.TRANSL: 我的學校在我們家旁邊，我天天走路去學校，也走路回家。
My school is next to our house, I walk to school every day, and I also walk home.

S.FORM: ini ktyaba ciyan pqawasn myan biru qani, ini kpiyux seto ru, mqbaq cami qabax.
S.TRANSL: 我們學校不大，沒有很多學生，大家互相認識。
Our school is not big, there are not many students, everyone knows each other.

S.FORM: msli cami cqa kki’an na csalan ru, msqun cami cisan boru, mkkayan cami uyi.
S.TRANSL: 所有小朋友會聚在操場，一起玩球、一起聊天。
All the children will gather in the playground, play ball and chat together.

S.FORM: baq msqun mcisan cami qa sesiy, giwan qutux muyax qa pqwasan biru qani.
S.TRANSL: 老師們也會和我們一起玩，學校是個大家庭。
The teachers also play with us, the school is one big family.

S.FORM: cmapuh cami krryax ru, blequn myan mcmapuh qa kki’an myan pqwasan qani.
S.TRANSL: 我們每天都要打掃，大家要把教室打掃乾淨。
We have to clean every day, and everyone has to clean the classroom.

S.FORM: mcmon tubun kruma cquliq ru, mcmapuh kruma cquliq.
S.TRANSL: 有些人去擦窗戶，有些人去掃地。
Some people clean the windows, some sweep the floor.

S.FORM: cpuhan myan qabax lingay na pqwasan biru, mbuyux ru mkrax cami, mlabu calay pqwasan biru krryax.
S.TRANSL: 我們還會打掃學校的各個角落，大家分工合作，學校每天都很乾淨。
We will also clean every corner of the school. Everyone works together, and the school is very clean every day.

S.FORM: chesa ga, mnwah cu mkan yutas cqa qalang.
S.TRANSL: 昨天，我去部落拜訪爺爺。
Yesterday, I went to visit my grandpa in the tribe.

S.FORM: bsyaq cami calay ini pktayux la, llungun mu calay hiya.
S.TRANSL: 我們很久沒有見面了，我很想念他。
We haven’t seen each other for a long time and I miss him a lot.

S.FORM: ktalan cu nya yutas mu lga, pniqan cu nya sikwa ru, pbxan cu nya ocya.
S.TRANSL: 爺爺一看到我，就請我吃西瓜，請我喝茶。
As soon as grandpa saw me, he invited me to eat watermelon and drink tea.

S.FORM: lbing calay sikwa mnuya ni yutas mu, blaq calay nniqun.
S.TRANSL: 爺爺種的西瓜很甜，真的很好吃。
The watermelon grown by grandpa is very sweet and really delicious.

S.FORM: siyan mu calay ocya na yutas mu, balaq calay buxn.
S.TRANSL: 我也喜歡爺爺的茶，也很好喝。
I also like grandpa’s tea, it’s tasted good too.

S.FORM: qlyan lga, msqun cu phayuy knryax ki yaki mu.
S.TRANSL: 中午的時候，我和奶奶一起煮午餐。
At noon, I cooked lunch with my grandma.

S.FORM: piyux calay pnhapuy knryax ni yaki mu, maki qulih, ngta, qabang ru knghi.
S.TRANSL: 奶奶煮了很豐盛的午餐，有魚、有雞、有南瓜、還有蝸牛。
Grandma cooked a big lunch, including fish, chicken, pumpkin, and snails.

S.FORM: mnaniq cami knryax lga, musa cami hmikut ramat cqa qmayah la.
S.TRANSL: 吃完午餐後，我們去菜園摘菜。
After lunch, we went to the vegetable garden to pick vegetables.

S.FORM: piyux calay ngahi cehuy ru qenux mniq cu ni yaki mu, aray muyax son cu nya.
S.TRANSL: 奶奶拿了很多地瓜、芋頭和蕗蕎給我，要我帶回家。
Grandma brought me a lot of sweet potatoes, taro and buckwheat, and asked me to take them home.

S.FORM: msgagay cami ki yutas ru yaki, kyalun mu mwah cu babaw nya loyi.
S.TRANSL: 我跟他們道別，說下次再去看他們。
I said goodbye to them and said I’d see them next time.

S.FORM: naray cami nya kki’an qbsinux qa sesiy ru, pbkux cami mna lasu blihun tbes kipu qani.
S.TRANSL: 今天老師帶我們去動物園，我們在門口排隊買票。
Today the teacher took us to the zoo, and we lined up at the gate to buy tickets.

S.FORM: miyuk cami cqa kki’an qbsinux qani lga, kyalun cami nya sesiy maha:“llasu ga kki’an ni qbhniq, mehong hiya ga kki’an ni maqu, ktayux kya cimu nanaq la.”
S.TRANSL: so you can visit them yourself.""
After entering the zoo, the teacher said, There are birds in the front and snakes in the back

S.FORM: mngungu cu maqu hiya, mica ini cu soya ktayux kki’an na maqu.
S.TRANSL: 我會怕蛇，所以我不看蛇類。
I'm afraid of snakes, so I don't look at snakes.

S.FORM: piyux wal mu ktalan qa qbhniq qani, mlaka cqa babaw na qhoniq, wal mu ktalan cyan m’abi cqa bling qhoniq qa lqum uyi.
S.TRANSL: 我看到了很多鳥，他們在樹上飛來飛去，還有看到貓頭鷹在樹洞裡睡覺。
I saw a lot of birds flying around in the trees and saw owls sleeping in tree hollows.

S.FORM: maki zow ru rme ru ngarux cqa kki’an qbsinux qani, iyat mu kintalan na qabax qbsinux qani, wal mu ktalan lga, mqas cu calay.
S.TRANSL: 動物園裡有大象、馬和老虎，我從前沒有看過這些動物，今天看到了真的很開心。
There are elephants, horses and tigers in the zoo. I have never seen these animals before. I was really happy to see them today.

S.FORM: piyux wayal mu psingan qa siyasin qani, pktalun mu yaba ru yaya mu.
S.TRANSL: 我拍了很多照片，給爸爸媽媽看。
I took a lot of pictures and showed them to my parents.

S.FORM: babaw nya lga, rayun mu ktayux yaba ru yaya mu.
S.TRANSL: 下次要跟爸爸媽媽一起來。
Next time I will come with my parents.

S.FORM: hngawan ryax qani ga, msqun cu qbsuyal mu kneril musa mkan mama myan cqa Tayto.
S.TRANSL: 這個假日，我和姊姊去台東拜訪叔叔。
This holiday, my sister and I went to Taitung to visit my uncle.

S.FORM: mglux cami kisya ru, kahol cami Bnka musa Tayto.
S.TRANSL: 我們從台北搭火車去臺東。
We took the train from Taipei to Taitung.

S.FORM: tehoq cami Tayto lga, qmet toruy qa mama ru, halan cami nya lmwah cqa eki.
S.TRANSL: 到了台東，叔叔開車來車站接我們。
When we arrived in Taitung, my uncle drove to the station to pick us up.

S.FORM: ini thiyaq ciyan eki ru muyax ni mama mu, ini cami kinga tehok muyax nya.
S.TRANSL: 車站離叔叔家沒有很遠，開車一下子就到了。
The station is not far from my uncle’s house, and it’s just a short drive away.

S.FORM: bih muyax ni mama mu ga, maki hlabang na kki’an knyatan ru, msqun cami qmet zitensya musa kya.
S.TRANSL: 叔叔家附近有個很大的牧場，我們一起騎腳踏車到牧場。
There is a big ranch near my uncle’s house, and we rode bicycles to the ranch together.

S.FORM: maki cami kya ga, rayun cami nya sm’an mit ru rme qa mama.
S.TRANSL: 在牧場，叔叔帶我們餵羊和騎馬。
In the ranch, my uncle took us to feed the sheep and ride horses.

S.FORM: gbyan lga, msqun cami musa maniq cqa maci.
S.TRANSL: 晚上，我們一起去市區吃飯。
In the evening, we went to the city to have dinner together.

S.FORM: piyux qa toruy na maci qani, mica qa qmet cami otobay musa kya.
S.TRANSL: 市區車子很多，所以我們騎摩托車去那裡。
There are a lot of cars in the city, so we go there by motorcycle.

S.FORM: uwah myan muyax lga, wal qriqun cquliq qa ototbay nya la, si cami glux basu mwah muyax la.
S.TRANSL: 要離開的時候，發現摩托車被偷了，我們只好搭公車離開。
When we were about to leave, we found that the motorcycle had been stolen, so we had to leave by bus.

S.FORM: tehok cami cqa Bnka lga, ini myan kbaki maha, kuna wal lun otobay ni mama mu la!
S.TRANSL: 現在我們回到台北了，不知道叔叔的摩托車找到了沒有！
Now that we are back in Taipei, I don’t know if my uncle’s motorcycle has been found.

S.FORM: laqi cu na ga, mnaki cami qalang Skikun, qaring cu mqwas biru lga, musa cami maki Girang la, ski mwani mqyanux cami cqa heci.
S.TRANSL: 小時候我們家住在四季，上學以後，就搬到了宜蘭，一直在都市裡生活。
When we were young, our family lived in Skikun. After I started school, we moved to Yilan and have been living in the city ever since.

S.FORM: mqwas cu raygako lga, musa cu tqbaq gaga qnxan na Tayal la, mica kbqun mu qabax mnanaq gaga na qnxan Genzuming.
S.TRANSL: 上了大學以後，我修了一堂關於原住民文化的課程，瞭解到臺灣原住民族有各式各樣豐富的文化。
After I went to college, I took a course on aboriginal culture and learned that the aboriginal people in Taiwan have various and rich cultures.

S.FORM: mica qa, ryax hngawan bagan ga, kingan ru qbsuyal mu mlikuy musa cami mkan bnheci cqa qalang, smoya cu calay tqbaq gaga na glux mu nanaq.
S.TRANSL: 因此，今年暑假時，我和哥哥回到部落訪問老人家，想要瞭解自己族群的文化。
So this summer, my brother and I went back to our tribe to visit the elderly, hoping to understand the culture of our own ethnic group.

S.FORM: ktalan mu bnheci qani ga spatun mpux kawas nya la, ana ga pisan hayi sening ktalan na.
S.TRANSL: 老人家已經八十歲了，但是看起來還像中年人。
The old man is already eighty years old, but he still looks like a middle-aged man.

S.FORM: tkbaqan mu, baq kmayan ke nanu qa hiya, bbaq ru hyuci calay knayan nya ke Tayal, baq kmayan ke kahat ru Truko ru ke Gipun uyi.
S.TRANSL: 我問他會哪些語言，他的泰雅語說得很流利，也會說閩南語、太魯閣語和日本話。
I asked him which languages he knew, and he was fluent in Atayal, as well as Hokkien, Truku and Japanese.

S.FORM: tqbaqan mu loyi ga. mica kbaqun mu maha, baq tgaring llaqi na ga, tqbaq ke Gipun, kneril nya kahul Truko ru, mqbaq piyux kahat cqa ptyawan nya.
S.TRANSL: 我問他才知道，原來他小時候就學日本話，太太是太魯閣族人，而他工作上認識許多閩南人，所以他會說這麼多語言。
I asked him to find out that he learned Japanese when he was a child, his wife is an Truku, and he knows many Hokkien at work, so he can speak so many languages.

S.FORM: mkkayan cami ki bnheci qani ga, piyux wal nya pinqiyan kinbaqan na qmalup qani.
S.TRANSL: 我們訪談的時候，老人家談論了許多關於狩獵的傳統知識。
During our interview, the old man talked about a lot of traditional knowledge about hunting.

S.FORM: ana myan ini kbaqi ciyan mung pinqiyan nya ga, wal myan halan ppsyasing ke pinqiyan nya, ana myan blequn mung qa ke nya loyi.
S.TRANSL: 雖然我們沒有辦法完全聽懂，但是我們有用手機錄影，可以再仔細聆聽。
Although we could’t fully understand it, we could record it on our cell phones and listen to it more.

S.FORM: llaqi cu na ga, ini mu kbaqi ciyan gaga na glux mu nanaq, mica mcayux cu hayi son ma cquliq cu Tayal.
S.TRANSL: 小時候我不瞭解自己族群的文化，對於自己是原住民有點不好意思。
When I was young, I didn’t understand the culture of my ethnic group, and I was a little embarrassed that I was an aborigine.

S.FORM: tqbaqan mu gaga qani lga, mqas cu calay son ma Tayal, mnanaq ru strahu mu ru ssyun mu calay inlungan.
S.TRANSL: 瞭解愈多以後，愈覺得自己身為泰雅族人，是很獨特的，也很值得驕傲。
The more I know, the more I feel that being a Tayal is unique and something to be proud of.

S.FORM: gbyan kisa ga, mwah muyax qa swahi mu mlikuy la.
S.TRANSL: 今天傍晚，弟弟就要回家了。
My younger brother is going home this evening.

S.FORM: musa cami mes ngta cqa ptbesan qqaya, alan myan phapuy k’abi qa swahi mu mlikuy.
S.TRANSL: 我和奶奶去市場買雞，準備煮好吃的晚餐給弟弟。
My grandma and I went to the market to buy chickens and prepared a delicious dinner for my younger brother.

S.FORM: hmenas cami tbesan ramat lga, piyux blaq ru mica na hnbiyat qa ramat maki tbesan ramat qani.
S.TRANSL: 我們經過了菜攤，菜攤有好多新鮮的青菜。
We passed the vegetable stand, which had a lot of fresh green vegetables.

S.FORM: mnes cami ramat horenso, qusaw ru raykon.
S.TRANSL: 我們買了空心菜、山藥和胡蘿蔔。
We bought water spinach, yams and carrots.

S.FORM: kmayan binah cyan tbes bway qa cquliq maha, “lbing calay onray ru qenam mu, bes cikay ga!”
S.TRANSL: 旁邊水果攤的老闆說:「我的鳳梨和桃子很甜。買一些吧!」
The owner of the nearby fruit stand said: “My pineapples and peaches are very sweet. Buy some!”

S.FORM: mnes cami onray ru qenam ki yaki mu.
S.TRANSL: 我們買了鳳梨和桃子。
We bought pineapples and peaches.

S.FORM: hmnas cami tbesan syam lga, kmayan qa tbes syam qa cquliq maha, “pbes su nanu? msyam calay ngta myan coni, qutux pila nya ga tyugan qbhul.”
S.TRANSL: 我們經過了肉攤，老闆說:「你要買什麼?今天的雞又大又肥，一隻300元。」
We passed the meat stall, and the boss said, “What do you want to buy? Today’s chickens are big and fat, and one is 300 NTD.”

S.FORM: mnglun yaki maha hmet ciyan la, hali khway cikay pila nya son nya qa tbesan syam qaca.
S.TRANSL: 奶奶覺得太貴了，問老闆可不可以便宜一點。
Grandma thought it was too expensive and asked the boss if it could be cheaper.

S.FORM: kmayan cquliq tbes syam qaca cimang pila nya la, ini kbqi pbiyaq pila nya la.
S.TRANSL: 但老闆說已經很便宜，不能再減了。
But the boss said that it is already very cheap and cannot be reduced any further.

S.FORM: kmayan binah qa cquliq maha, “uwah mes qulih mu, cimam pila besun ru tyaba qa qulih mu qani.”
S.TRANSL: 隔壁的老闆說，來買我的魚，我的魚又大又便宜。
The boss next door said, come and buy my fish, my fish is big and cheap.

S.FORM: pucing nya lga mnes cami ngta ru qulih, musa cami muyax ru hpuyan myan qa ramat qani la.
S.TRANSL: 最後我們買了雞也買了魚，回家煮了一桌子的菜。
In the end we bought chicken and fish, and went home to cook a table of food.

S.FORM: bsyaq cami mna ru, mnkung qa kayal nya la.
S.TRANSL: 等了好久，天已經黑了。
After waiting for a long time, it was already dark.

S.FORM: mnwah renwa qa swahi mu mlikuy maha, ini cami qbaq mhngaw coni la, aky ski cqa babaw hngawan ryax ga, baq cu mwah muyax la.
S.TRANSL: 弟弟打電話回來說，軍隊突然不能放假了，要下一個禮拜日才回來。
The younger brother called back and said that the army suddenly couldn’t take a vacation and would not be back until the next Sunday.

S.FORM: kmayan yaki talagay nhapuy qani la, tapih qabax lpyung uwah squn mniq kusa.
S.TRANSL: 奶奶說已經煮了這麼多，叫大家一起來吃吧!
Grandma said that she has cooked so much, so let’s eat together!

S.FORM: mwah qabax qa lpyung ru, msqun cami mniq k’abi nhapuy ni yaki.
S.TRANSL: 我們邀請了親朋好友，一起來享用豐盛的晚餐。
We invited friends and family to have a great dinner together.

S.FORM: maki qutux seto mu Pasan lalu nya, mngi maray qqaya krryax qa hiya.
S.TRANSL: 我有一個同學叫Pasan，他常常忘記帶東西。
I have a classmate named Pasan, he often forgets to bring things.

S.FORM: mqwas cami biru ga, musa ksiyux seto cqa enpit ccom ru brban qa hiya.
S.TRANSL: 上課的時候，他跟同學借鉛筆、橡皮擦或是筆記本。
During class, he borrowed pencils, erasers or notebooks from his classmates.

S.FORM: minqutux, mnxan ru mtyugan ga, ksyuxan myan qqaya hiya ha.
S.TRANSL: 一次、兩次、三次，大家會借東西給他。
Once, twice, three times, everyone would lend him something.

S.FORM: ana ga qutih calay kako nya la, ksiyuxan myan qqaya lga ini cami biqi loyi.
S.TRANSL: 但是他有個壞習慣，經常借了東西卻不還。
But he has a bad habit of often borrowing things but not returning them.

S.FORM: pucing nya lga, ini myan siyay ksiyux qqaya hiya la.
S.TRANSL: 最後大家都不想借他東西了。
In the end, no one wanted to borrow anything from him.

S.FORM: minqutux ryax, musa cami mcisan habax myan.
S.TRANSL: 有一天，我們大家一起去郊遊。
One day, we all went on an outing together.

S.FORM: cka ryaniq na ga, akya musa stanux qa Pasan qani. ana ga wal mngi maray ciligami qa Pasan la.
S.TRANSL: 路途中，Pasan想上廁所，但他忘記帶衛生紙。
On the way, Pasan wanted to go to the bathroom, but he forgot to bring toilet paper.

S.FORM: akya musa ksiyux ciligami seto qa hiya, kmayan qabax naha, ini cami aray uyi.
S.TRANSL: 他跟同學借衛生紙，可是大家都回他說，我也沒有帶耶。
He borrowed toilet paper from his classmates, but everyone told him that I didn’t bring them either.

S.FORM: mnkux ru mngilis qa Pasan qani la, myuhung kmayan maha, cwa mamu ini ksyuxi ciligami kingan!
S.TRANSL: Pasan急的哭了出來，他生氣的說，為什麼大家都不借我衛生紙!
Pasan burst into tears. He said angrily, why don’t everyone lend me toilet paper!

S.FORM: kyalun ni seto maha, cwa su ini aray nanaq, ana ga wal su myan ksyuxan qqaya ga, ini su calay biqi cami loyi!
S.TRANSL: 同學告訴他，因為你都不自己帶，而且借給你的東西，你都不會還!
The classmate told him, because you didn’t bring it yourself, and you wouldn’t return the things lent to you!

S.FORM: kncyuxan nya mwah cami mqwas biru lga, mhyuboq tehoq pqwasan biru qa Pasan ru, sbiq cami nya qabax wal myan ksyuxan hiya qa qqaya la.
S.TRANSL: 隔天上學，Pasan很早就到學校了，Pasan把跟同學借的東西都還給同學們。
The next day at school, Pasan arrived at school early and returned everything he had borrowed from his classmates.

S.FORM: nway son nya qabax seto ru, kyalun cami nya maha p’aray cu nanaq qqaya babaw nya la, mhway cimu ru smwan cimu pksiyux qqaya kingan.
S.TRANSL: Pasan向同學們道歉，並說他以後一定會自己帶東西，也謝謝同學們之前願意借他東西。
Pasan apologized to the students and said that he would definitely bring his own things in the future, and thanked the classmates for their willingness to lend him things before.

S.FORM: yaba mu ga cquliq na qmalup maki cqa qalang.
S.TRANSL: 我的爸爸是部落的獵人。
My dad is a hunter of the tribe.

S.FORM: llaqi cu na ga, mhngan musa ttanux qa yaba ru mama mu, maray lalaw ru patus naha.
S.TRANSL: 我小的時候，爸爸和叔叔會在晚上出門，帶著獵刀和獵槍。
When I was little, my dad and uncle would go out at night with hunting knives and guns.

S.FORM: tmma’ lga, maray qbsinux naha mwah la.
S.TRANSL: 天亮時，他們就會帶著獵到的獵物回來。
At daybreak, they returned with their prey.

S.FORM: kruma ga biyok ru yapit, kruma uyi ga maki biyut uyi.
S.TRANSL: 有時候是山豬、有時候是飛鼠，偶爾也會有雉雞。
Sometimes it was a boar, sometimes a flying squirrel, and occasionally a pheasant.

S.FORM: qsyuxan naha qa qbsinux maki cqa qalang ru, sbiq naha cquliq uyi.
S.TRANSL: 他們會在村口將獵物分好，分享給族人。
They would divide the prey at the entrance of the village and share it with the tribe.

S.FORM: tkibux cu yaba mu krryax, smoya cu mglux musa qmalup qa yaba.
S.TRANSL: 我每次都會吵著爸爸，要跟著爸爸去打獵。
Every time I quarreled with my father, I wanted to go hunting with my father.

S.FORM: kmayan yaba maha, long cikay tyaba kawas su lga, rayaw misu la.
S.TRANSL: 爸爸說等我長大了他再帶我一起去。
Dad said that he would take me with me when I grew up.

S.FORM: baq smi mrusa kruma cquliq uyi, sqbalay naha skakay, sqolu ru rangay.
S.TRANSL: 部落的男人也會用陷阱抓獵物，他們會製作套索陷阱和石壓式陷阱。
The men of the tribe also trap their prey, making lasso traps and rock traps.

S.FORM: bbaq calay smi skakay ru sqolu qa yaba mu, kmayan yaba maha, qani hiya ga pkiyap biyut hiya, akya blequn ktayux tuqi na qbsinux qani, ssyan ta cqa qnapan wahan na qbsinux qani.
S.TRANSL: 我的爸爸很會製作套索陷阱，爸爸說，這是用來捕抓雉雞的，我們要仔細觀察獵物的腳印，陷阱要放在獵物走的路上。

My dad is very good at making lasso traps. Dad said that this is used to catch pheasants. We have to carefully observe the footprints of the prey, and the traps should be placed on the path of the prey.

S.FORM: eta ta helax hayi mglux yaba musa qmalup maha cu, nyan cu si tqbaq smi rusa krryax, maha cqani lga ini kinga baq ciliq rusa mu la.
S.TRANSL: 為了可以趕快和大人一起去打獵，我每天練習製作陷阱，很快地我的陷阱就真的可以抓到獵物了。
In order to go hunting with adults as soon as possible, I practiced making traps every day, and soon my traps can really catch prey.

S.FORM: ktalan cu ni yaba mu lga, baq kmayan maha, babaw nya ga akya su bbaq calay qmalup na cquliq.
S.TRANSL: 爸爸看到後對我說我以後一定會是很厲害的獵人。
Dad saw it and told me that I will be a very good hunter in the future.

S.FORM: nyan cu mrkyas ru tyaba kawas la, panan mu bhenux bneloq ru tlqi, mglux cu yaba mu musa qmalup.
S.TRANSL: 現在我長大了，我背起我的弓和箭矢，跟著爸爸一起去打獵。
Now that I have grown up, I carry my bow and arrows and go hunting with my father.

S.FORM: mwah cami muyax lga, sqasux myan cquliq qabax cniliq myan qani.
S.TRANSL: 回村時將獵到的獵物和族人們分享。
When returning to the village, share the hunted prey with the tribe.

S.FORM: kmayan yaba, lanay ta shuway knalu na utux bnheci ta, sbiq ta nya piyux na qbsinux qani.
S.TRANSL: 爸爸說，我們要感謝祖靈賜福，讓我們有很多獵物收穫。
Dad said, we want to thank the ancestors for their blessings, so that we have a lot of prey to harvest.

S.FORM: cuqi cu musa pinqwasan biru saniq coni.
S.TRANSL: 我早上上學遲到了。
I was late for school this morning.

S.FORM: mnwah cu pinqwasan ga, mingi cu maray kabang bbiru.
S.TRANSL: 去學校的時候，我忘了帶書包。
When I was going to school, I forgot to bring my backpack.

S.FORM: ana nanu qnqaya ini cu aray.
S.TRANSL: 我什麼東西都沒有帶。
I didn't bring anything with me.

S.FORM: t’arang mqwas ga, kingan ki glux mu ga squn cami mktayax biru.
S.TRANSL: 上課的時候，我和同學一起看課本。
During class, I and my classmates read the textbook together.

S.FORM: pcpngan pinqwasan ga, k’syuxun cu nya ppbiru ro ccom qa glux mu.
S.TRANSL: 考試的時候，同學借我筆和橡皮擦。
During the exam, a classmate lent me a pen and an eraser.

S.FORM: kyalun cu nya sesiy maha, “m_yubuq hayi mtuliq saniq babaw nya, ta mcuqi la!”
S.TRANSL: 老師跟我說：「下次早點起床，不要再遲到了!」
The teacher told me, Wake up earlier next time and don't be late again!""

S.FORM: Silan cnlalu nya qa blaq na lpyung mu, hiya ga laqi na Tayal uyi.
S.TRANSL: 我的好朋友叫Silan，他也是泰雅族的小孩。
My good friend’s name is Silan, and he is also an Tayal child.

S.FORM: nyan cami glux mqwas biru qa qalang Skikun.
S.TRANSL: 我們一起在四季部落讀書。
We study together in the Skikun tribe.

S.FORM: squn myan mung ke bnheci na tyaba kawas krryax, baq cami kmayal ke Tayal qabax.
S.TRANSL: 我們常常一起聽耆老說故事，我們都很會說泰雅語。
We often listen to the elders telling stories together, and we both can speak the Tayal proficiently.

S.FORM: hlawax cu calay ro mqthoy cu calay uyi, Silan hiya ga mrroq calay ro mhekang calay uyi.
S.TRANSL: 我很高也很胖，Silan很矮也很瘦。
I am tall and overweight, while Silan is short and thin.

S.FORM: Silan hiya ga msuna blaq mqyanux calay, siyan nya hiya qabax ta.
S.TRANSL: Silan很有活力，大家都很喜歡他。
Silan is very energetic, and everyone likes him a lot.

S.FORM: unrokay na pqwasan ryax coni, pqwasan ga rmurux knpiyux na pcpngan.
S.TRANSL: 今天是學校的運動會，學校舉辦了許多競賽。
Today was the school's sports day, and the school organized many competitions.

S.FORM: maki pcpngan na hmuluy qthoy gasil, klkah boru, mktlyung, ppiyuy, ro mu’ slqi.
S.TRANSL: 有拔河、足球、跑步、跳舞和射箭。
There were tug of war, soccer, running, dancing, and archery.

S.FORM: mcpung cu mktlyung.
S.TRANSL: 我比賽跑步。
I participated in the running competition.

S.FORM: trang mktlyung cu ga, mtakuy cu la, piyux sramu ciyan ramu na tari mu la.
S.TRANSL: 當我跑步的時候，我跌倒了，膝蓋流了很多血。
When I was running, I fell down, and my knees were bleeding.

S.FORM: ana ga mtuliq cu, si cu skura glasux mktlyung.
S.TRANSL: 但我站起來，繼續向前跑。
But I stood up and continued running forward.

S.FORM: eta cu qes pcingan laga, qabax cquliq ga mqas lungan naha qabax.
S.TRANSL: 我到終點時所有人都很開心。
Everyone was happy when I reached the finish line.

S.FORM: ana cu ini agal cnlalu te qutux qnabu, ana ga mqas cu calay, baha hmcwa wan mu msqun pcpngan qani la.
S.TRANSL: 雖然沒有獲得第一名，但我很高興，因為我完成了比賽。
Although I didn't get first place, I'm glad because I completed the race.

S.FORM: chesa kingan ru yaba mu ga mnwah cami mkan mama mu.
S.TRANSL: 昨天我和爸爸去拜訪我的叔叔。
Yesterday, my father and I visited my uncle.

S.FORM: cyan mqelis kakay mama mu la.
S.TRANSL: 叔叔的腳受傷了。
My uncle injured his foot.

S.FORM: kyalun cami nya, nya mbling qa rnamux muyax la.
S.TRANSL: 他告訴我們，房子的屋頂破了一個洞。
He told us that there was a hole in the roof of his house.

S.FORM: kblayun nya rnamux muyax ga, knahul rnamux wan mtoruy la.
S.TRANSL: 他在修理屋頂時，從屋頂摔下來了。
He fell off the roof while repairing it.

S.FORM: maray he kacing ru bingro yaba biqan nya mama.
S.TRANSL: 爸爸帶了牛肉和檳榔給叔叔。
My father brought beef and betel nuts for my uncle.

S.FORM: kingan ro mama ga mcisal cami kya iyik ’bayn, piyux ke bnheci qsyuxun cu nya kmayal.
S.TRANSL: 我和叔叔在房間裡聊天，他分享了很多故事。
My uncle and I chatted in the room, and he shared many stories.

S.FORM: iyik shriq cu ga, trahu cu nyan mama maha wan su mhlawax la. wan su qenah betunux ciyal.
S.TRANSL: 我要離開前，叔叔誇我長高了，也變得更帥氣了。
Before I left, my uncle praised me for growing taller and becoming more handsome.

S.FORM: kyalun mu maha nna mblaq kakay mama laga, babaw nya uwah mcisal muyax myan uyi.
S.TRANSL: come to our house next time and visit us.""
I said, When your foot gets better

S.FORM: maki saying seng ro pusan saying kawas, wan mcqrux lhuyan qa Sexu, mkkayal maha, lalu na Tayal ga ana nanak sbiru ta babaw kya Nibunsyo.
S.TRANSL: 在2022年，政府召開了原住民身分證可單列族名的會議。
In 2022, the government announced that indigenous identification cards can include tribal names separately.

S.FORM: nwahan mu tqbaq mrkyas na qalang qa Pasang Yawi, knbsyaq kihuy skura Sexu qa magal yaw sqa lalu na Tayal ga huyay nanak sbiru babaw kya Nibunsyo la.
S.TRANSL: 我訪問了長期向政府爭取身分證「單列族名」的部落青年Pasang Yawi。
I interviewed Pasang Yawi, a young tribal member who has long been advocating for the inclusion of tribal names on identification cards.

S.FORM: kingan ro hiya ga lman cami mkkayal, ryax hngawan qani ga musa cu muyax nya mkan hiya.
S.TRANSL: 我和他約定好這個假日到他家訪問他。
We had arranged to visit his home this holiday for the interview.

S.FORM: cka na nwahan mu tqbaq ga, cbaqan cu nya puying yaw qa lalu nya, rayun cu nya pnbaq qabax cinmuyax nya ro qalang nya uyi.
S.TRANSL: 在訪問的過程中，他向我介紹了他的名字的由來，也帶我認識了他的家人、他的部落。
During the interview, he introduced to me the origin of his name and also introduced me to his family and tribe.

S.FORM: pqutan mu hiya, hmcwa squxan su lungan qa m’iyux lalu qani, ini kblaq snyan su miru lalu cyunga?
S.TRANSL: 我問他為什麼堅持要改名，舊的登記方式不好嗎?
I asked him why he insisted on changing his name. Wasn’t the old registration method sufficient?

S.FORM: kyalun cu nya hiya maha, baha hmcwa, sbiru patas na ke Cyukok qani ga ini huyay pinktayux qa hngya’an na lalu nya, binah cquliq ga sgyun nya maha “pa syeng seng”, mica nya tmwang piyux calay na pinssyaqan uyi.
S.TRANSL: \" which resulted in many jokes being made."
He told me that using Chinese characters could not accurately convey his name, and others would still call him \Ba Xian Sheng

S.FORM: kmayal Pasang Yawi maha, “tmamas pintasan biru lalu na Genzyumin ga musa calay pktayux sqa lalu ta, lalu mu hiya ga kingiwan cnlalu na mirok ta, glux ta, sinrxan ta, sinnnay ta qenah musa piyux glux ta Tayal ga baq m’ulu lalu naha nanak.”
S.TRANSL: our family
Pasang Yawi said, \The names written in indigenous languages are our true names. My name represents our ethnic group

S.FORM: kingan ro yaki mnwah cami smi qnqaya ptbesan kya, piyux rramat pinnuyax yaki ga naray nya kya, biqan nya qabax ta nniqun na Genzyumin qa knalay nya.
S.TRANSL: 昨天我跟奶奶去市集擺攤，奶奶帶了許多自己種的蔬菜去，也製作了原住民美食給大家。
Yesterday, I went to the market with my grandmother to set up a stall. My grandmother brought a lot of vegetables that she grew herself and also prepared indigenous cuisine for everyone.

S.FORM: qabax naha ga siyan nya ptbesan na yaki, kuriq ro kbaqit ga piyux cquliq mes, piyux calay cquliq tmalam rramat tnahuk nya.
S.TRANSL: 大家很喜歡奶奶的攤位，辣椒和山蘇很多人買，許多人來品嘗她煮的菜餚。
Everyone loved my grandmother’s stall. Many people bought the chilis and African eggplants, and many people came to taste the dishes she cooked.

S.FORM: tnahuk nya mala ro sumul ga blaq niqun calay, maki loyi tnahuk nya biyok tnwang maqaw, nyan hmuluy lungan cquliq lmosay qa kinsokan nya, nyan si cqrux kya ptbesan myan ro nna mes.
S.TRANSL: 她煮的蕨菜和糯米飯非常好吃，還有用山豬肉煮的馬告滷肉，味道吸引了很多客
The ferns and sticky rice she cooked were delicious, as well as the braised pork with maqaw pepper and wild boar meat. The flavors attracted many customers, and everyone lined up at our stall.

S.FORM: trang stahuk nniqun yaki ga, sgyun mu cquliq lmosay, phngiyang cu hmwaw, rramat qani ga pnuya myan nanak, rakis calay, helax uwah mes wah!
S.TRANSL: all-natural and organic! Come and buy now!\""
While my grandmother was cooking, I was on the side attracting customers. I shouted, \The vegetables are self-grown

S.FORM: helax suqun ptbes qa qnqaya myan, kman yaki maha, baha hmcwa ga, “ulung maki isu rmax.”
S.TRANSL: 我們的東西很快就賣完了，奶奶說：「都是因為有你的幫忙。」
Our goods sold out quickly, and my grandmother said, \It’s all thanks to your help.\""

S.FORM: yaw qani, wan mu tnbaqan yaw na k’man, kkhoniq Tayal ro tnbaqan na nniqun, pnbaq cu uwiy calay musa ptbes qnqaya ptbesan qani.
S.TRANSL: 這個活動，我學到了有關原住民植物和食品的知識，並且體驗到了擺攤的辛苦。
Through this event, I learned about indigenous plants and food and experienced the hard work of running a stall.

S.FORM: kntalan mu siyan nya lungan calay qabax nniqun Tayal qani qa yaki, pqasun mu ro mqoyat cu calay uyi.
S.TRANSL: 看到了奶奶對傳統食物的熱愛，我感到非常驕傲和榮幸。
Seeing my grandmother’s passion for traditional food, I feel very proud and honored.
